frontmatter.title: How I automated day to day GitHub routine with GitHub Toolbelt
frontmatter.description: Time is not money. Time is a more precious thing. After getting tired of constant mis-clicks and repeated keyboard work, decided to save some of my time and build a tool for managing a GitHub PR pipeline.

frontmatter.title: My ultimate (soon) list of awesome opensource projects
frontmatter.description: This is a constantly work-in-progress list of cool project I have encountered or worked with.

frontmatter.title: How I migrated from Redux and Saga to MobX and became a happier person
frontmatter.description: For quite a while I was using Redux together with Redux Saga and was satisfied. Well, sort of, because I was constantly asking myself "Should the state management always be that complex?" Redux was a great library for it's time, when the concept of a centralized state was not well-coined yet. Nevertheless, one day came, and I have decided it was time to move.

frontmatter.title: My console cheat-sheet
frontmatter.description: There are some things that can be useful to me, but I totally keep forgetting the syntax. Well, not any longer!

frontmatter.title: How to calculate actual color for opacity on white background
frontmatter.description: From time to time I observe designers making derivative colors by applying opacity to a base color against white background. While this approach works perfectly fine with wireframes, in the markup an element might not be always located on white. Therefore we need to know exact hex value to make use of it.

frontmatter.title: How to set RaspberryPi up for NodeJS projects
frontmatter.description: After failing to find a complete and correct guide on how to set up RaspberryPi4 for NodeJS development right, I have decided to make my own instruction.

frontmatter.title: How to make a code generator in 5 minutes (or less)
frontmatter.description: Every software engineer and every company at some point tries to preserve the knowledge of best practices and know-how-s, in order to prevent making the same mistakes or extra work over and over again. Here is how this problem can be tackled.

frontmatter.title: How to deploy an application to Heroku using Docker
frontmatter.preview: I am extremely fascinated with a container-based approach. I try to ship every application as a Docker container because in this case, the application becomes an infrastructure provider agnostic. So this time we will see how to deploy a dockerized application to Heroku  a famous cloud platform.
frontmatter.description: I am extremely fascinated with a container-based approach. I try to ship every application as a Docker container because in this case, the application becomes an infrastructure provider agnostic. So this time we will see how to deploy a dockerized application to Heroku  a famous cloud platform.

frontmatter.title: How to use DynamoDB with Apollo GraphQL and NodeJS Serverless
frontmatter.description: In the previous article we discussed how to set up Apollo with Serverless. Now we talk about how to put the DynamoDB database behind that Apollo client.

frontmatter.title: How to use React Hooks
frontmatter.description: React 16.7.0 is finally out. It has no hooks on-board, but sooner or later, React Hooks will be there. So today we will have a talk so were ready to use it right away when it is time

frontmatter.title: How to use GraphQL Apollo server with Serverless
frontmatter.description: In the previous article, we have discussed how to use Serverless locally with Webpack and then deploy it to the AWS cloud. Today we talk about how to spin up Apollo GraphQL server inside a lambda function.

frontmatter.title: How to use Serverless with Webpack and Docker
frontmatter.description: I am sure many of us know about Serverless. For those, who is not familiar: Serverless is a system architecture concept which allows us to put our backend code into the cloud.

frontmatter.title: My recipe for making Meteor project deployment in Centos 7 environment
frontmatter.description: This is a story of how I am going to tell you a story about how I prepare the production environment for a Meteor application in a very detailed manner. Anyway, we all should know how it is usually done by hands, when no Docker or any other special software involved, shouldn`t we?
